rComments: This woman is insanely brilliant. I couldn't understand why I disliked her lectures at first until the class was almost over and I realized that I (and many others) were simply not trained into such critical thinking. It was a wake-up call when I realized how INTELLIGENT Donna is. Give her a chance! You won't regret it. Loved by all.

I took this course for a GE and expected it to be moderately easy, but she's a rough grader. If you ask for help, she'll drag on and on about meaningless things but SLIGHTLY give you help. I was hoping this would be an interesting class but her lectures are just boring. I don't recommend this class.

Absolutely horrible. She rambles on and on and on. Nothing she says in class will help you on the tests at all. Not to mention we were suppose to have a midterm today she didn't even bother to show up and we couldn't take the test, there is yet to be an explanation as to why she didn't show up.

I was really excited to take this class but was really disappointed. The lecture's are really boring and not at all engaging . There are also three essays that are worth a ton of your grade but what's expected is not at all clear until you get a bad grade. Wouldn't recommend taking.

Donna is a great professor, she knows her stuff and is very opened to discussing all the material. But, she does go off topic from the course material a lot. The tangents are very interesting though and do make you think a lot about other things.  I would have her as a professor again, just make sure to read. Seriously.

Donna was a wonderful professor. Sometimes had a hard time responding to emails in a timely manner but is very willing to make sure students do well! Just talk to her and go to her office hours. Does get side tracked during lecture as well but it wasn't terrible. She's passionate about what she teaches and understanding of students' lives.

If you have any actual interest in the subject (history of French painting), you will enjoy this class. Donna is an expert; she's been studying the material for 30+ years. Long lectures: she talks a ton, but always tries to be very accurate. Assignments are easy. Reading can be a pain but isn't that bad. I really enjoyed it.

Assigns 2 essays and 1 final essay. Weekly readings and brief notes due. Reading lengths vary but are very helpful for essays. Very knowledgeable but monotonous and boring in class lectures. Really appreciates class participation. Attendance not mandatory.  Friendly teacher, easy A. No textbooks needed.

3 essays and 2 exams in the class. She's really boring and lecture doesn't really help you with the essays and exams at all. You're better off skipping the class and just coming on the days when there's a test or when she hands back the tests. The grading is ok, cuz even when I BS'd about stuff I don't really know, I still got a passing grade.
Nice teacher, stupidly easy class. Grades really lightly.

The professor is very sweet and approachable but lectures can be hard to sit through since she talks for the entirety of the class with hardly a break to take a breath. They are helpful though, if you need clarity for assigned readings. Paper assignments are long but as long as you attend section (mandatory) and read, they are doable.

This class is unbearable. While the assignments are very doable, the lecture itself is so boring. I very rarely attend and it doesn't seem to impact my paper grades. Great assigned readings, but the lecture about them sucks. Professor seems very nice but is not a good lecturer. Overall, just one of those requirements we have to suffer through.

While I agree that she is disorganized, she tells you EXACTLY what she's looking for in the assignments she gives, making it incredibly easy on your part to deliver and in turn, receive a good grade (not always a common trend in HAVC classes!). If you need help, approach her. She's sweet and helpful. Interact with her in lectures; it will help.

Really great seminar prof. I also took her 10F class back in the day. She's better in upper level seminars than intro lecture classes. Really nice to students. Regardless of some organizational flaws, the content of her courses is always outstanding. Students with less interest or poor study habits will not be able to appreciate her best quailities

I hoped the class would be at least mildly interesting, but it turned out to be the worst waste of time I have ever had the misfortune to endure. For a Harvard graduate (yeah right), Donna is a horrible professor with no organization and a complete lack of ability to teach effectively. Her lectures are as boring as they can get. NOT RECOMMENDED.

Worst class I have taken so far. She is extremely unorgainized and makes you angry because she doens't lead class. She rambles like no other and never gets a real conversation going before class is over. The material would be 100 times more interesting if Hunter was not the professor.

She was very disorganized, but was a good person at heart. She would babble on, but the class in itself is pretty easy. She laid down the test. And she strives for fairness to all the students. Humor her.

was a horrible lecturer. would babble on and on about things not on the exams. would give backstories, but not the important stuff. she gets confused with her wording, and can't control the class. it took her 2 weeks to actually start on the lessons- she was distracted with enrolling and locations on a map. the TAs taught basically

Donna is compassionate and is interested in the well-being of her students. However, she is very disorganized and seems nervous in her lectures. Lectures often start late and are usually all over the place. Although an art student, her teaching style turned me off from studying art history. HAVC 10F is easy, but she is not a good professor.

Hands down the worst professor I've had at UCSC. Extremely disorganized, very scattered,frequently goes off topic. Due yourself a favor and do the reading rather than try to understand her ridiculous style of teaching. Having a good TA is also very helpful

this woman was INSANE. INCOMPREHENSIBLE. rambled constantly. would address the slides in the LAST 5 minutes of class & would spend the first 65 minutes talking about absolutely NOTHING pertinent. I was told to be quiet in lecture even though everything she was saying was USELESS. sections also pointless. be prepared for unorganized EVERYTHING w her

As a non-HAVC major, I found her teaching style abominable. She rarely started the lecture within 20 minutes of arriving, and then only got to the analysis of the art in the last 15 minutes. She seems to talk too fast for her thoughts and use 20 words when 5 would work. Easy to pass without attending lecture though.

Oh wow. Donna's lectures are dreadful. She wastes an exorbitant amount of time in class (repeating things, showing websites, and generally being unprepared) and then tries to cram everything into the last ten minutes, when people are already restless and bored. It's easy, but painful.
It is so hard to sit through her lectures. She is all over the place and repeats herself a lot.

She's a nice person, but it's impossible to follow her train of thought, her rambling got worse and worse through the quarter. Whenever someone shifted in the audience she would spaz out and forget what she was talking about. The reading in German art was drrrrrrry..
Great Teacher!!!

Worst art history class EVER. No clear line of thought, no image analysis, terribly confusing, tangents that aren't even interesting, etc. Waste of time on a subject I was really interested in. Not too hard, depends on TA.

I have her currently for German Literature, and let me tell you I'm confused.  Her lectures blast in and out of time periods, and she forgets to tell you key information, basic information about the art.  She explains lots of thematic and exagerates everything but her wild movements, but fails to introduce the very basics and necessary information.

Art history majors will love her. Some may complain about tangents, but she provides cultural context that expands on the milieu and social history of the work. She's kinetic and active, and her brain goes ten different directions at once, all while staying focused on the topic. Just pay attention, and you'll get it. A wonderful and fun professor..
She is nice, smart and presents concise lectures.  Take this one if you get a chance.-ace

more tangents than relevant material, inefficient time management (often spent 20-30 min "taking care of business" before starting actual lecture), repetitive repetitive repetitive...but through all the unnecessary bits of the class, the material was very interesting. also she looks like a female lewis black.

Art history goddess...a total inspiration. I took Donna's portraiture seminar, which I was initally scared of, and loved it. She is brilliant, kind, funny, and completely interested in her students and their work. Not at all full of herself, unlike other professors in the department. The antithesis of an art snob. Amazing woman.

Donna is a great teacher. She knows more about art history than most professors in the department, and she always shows an interest in what shes teaching, regardless of what level it is. She's also really funny, offers lots of extra information in her lectures, and is really, really nice and always willing to help. Highly recommended.

Donna is wonderful, one of those professors who occasionally graces your college career.  Funny, bright, and wickedly smart, her humor alone keeps her from being intimidating.  A great pleasure in the classroom.

I think Donna is rad, Ive had her for more than one class, and honestly, she just is so intellegent and nice.. Shes funny sometimes too. If you enjoy learning random stuff, and also being challenged a bit, then take one of her classes. P.S. being late doesnt make you a terrible teacher
Tends to go off on tangents during lecture and isn't always clear with concepts...but very informed and overall not a bad teacher.

Excellent.  She has much information to impart, I like a teacher who goes into depth about things.  She knows what she is talking about! (Oh BOO HOO a teacher is late a couple times...ARE you REALLY complaining about that?) She definitly made up for it during lecture.
She's very good.  Her lecture style can wander at times, but she wants nothing more than for her students to learn.  Unlike Soussloff, she's incredibley intelligent, but isn't self-absorbed about it.

It's a shame such a brilliant educator must teach a lower-division class where her so many can't keep up.Those who complain about her lectures will never get them, it isn't elitism, its intelligence and patience they're lacking. Ifyou'relookingfor an interesting topic taught by a good prof, takeit

theonlyreasonpeople sleepinherclassis b/c thelights r turnedoffthe wholelecturetolook at slides. she lectures fast, goes into detail about the artpieces and goes into interesting stories sometimes. your grade is 40% test 15% sec participation, the rest 3 essays; interesting to talk to about anything

She is late to class almost everyday. Her lectures feel like death. Everyone sleeps in that class, even the TAs. Tests are pretty hard and they are graded very hard. The funny thing is that she is nice even though she is boring, hard, and constantly late.
First-rate Modernist. She knows more than most about Weimar, so how can you not love her?

She is probably the worst teacher i have ever had.  She's always at least 10 min. late for class... sometimes even later.  She couldnt work the slide projectors for the first 4 weeks of class.  her tests are hard.  NOT RECOMENDED
